content: this pattern allows you to make best use of those single almost full balls of yarn you have lying around equally a great way to combine two balls of special yarn into a treasured piece whilst this involves stranded colour-work it s the easiest colour-work you ll ever do there are no charts involved with a simple 2x2 repeat and no counting a perfect introduction to stranded knitting **materials** - around 40g /120 metres 155 yards dk or sport weight yarn each of colour a and colour b some dk yarns come in 50g/90-100m balls it s fine to use these but you may find your cowl a little shorter alternatively think about casting on less stitches and making it a little more snug 3mm us 2 5 & 3 5mm us 4 60cm circular knitting needles **measurements** 60cm diameter 24 x 21cm tall 8 5 in pattern **gauge** not too important 22sts width x 30sts height per 10cm squared
